web|last1=Freeman|first1=Molly|title=Idris Elba Talks Luke Cage & Debunks 'King Arthur' Casting Rumor|url=http://screenrant.com/idris-elba-luke-cage-king-arthur/|website=Screenrant|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref>
===Filming=== Filming in [[Windsor Great Park]] was underway in February 2015,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.geograph.org.uk/photo/4366390|title=Vans & signs left after filming (C) Phillip Williams : Geograph Britain and Ireland|author=Phillip Williams|publisher=geograph.org.uk|accessdate=February 2, 2016}}</ref> then later in [[North Wales]] from March 2, 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=On the Set for 3/2/15: Matthew McConaughey & Gugu Mbatha-Raw Start 'Free State of Jones', 'Kickboxer' Wraps & More|url=http://www.ssninsider.com/on-the-set-for-3215-matthew-mcconaughey-gugu-mbatha-raw-start-free-state-of-jonas-kickboxer-wraps-more/|accessdate=March 7, 2015|publisher=ssninsider.com|date=March 2, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150305164446/http://www.ssninsider.com/on-the-set-for-3215-matthew-mcconaughey-gugu-mbatha-raw-start-free-state-of-jonas-kickboxer-wraps-more/|archivedate=5 March 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Later on March 10, 2015, Ritchie tweeted a photo and confirmed the first day of shooting.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}}<!-- WP:RS needed; removed link to WP:SPS (Twitter, FB, WP)--> In April 2015, filming took place in [[Snowdonia]], where locations used were [[Tryfan]], [[Nant Gwynant]] near [[Beddgelert]] and [[Capel Curig]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Crump|first1=Eryl|title=Filming of Hollywood movie King Arthur set to start in Snowdonia|url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/filming-hollywood-movie-king-arthur-9017977|accessdate=April 12, 2015|publisher=dailypost.co.uk|date=April 10, 2015}}</ref> Early in July filming continued in the [[Shieldaig]], [[Loch Torridon]] and [[Applecross]] areas of [[Wester Ross]] in the Scottish Highlands.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}} One day of filming also took place at The [[Quiraing]] on the Isle of [[Skye]]. Filming also took place at [[Warner Bros. Studios, Leavesden]].{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
==Release== In April 2014, ''[[Warner Bros.]]'' set the film for a July 22, 2016 release, alongside ''[[Lights Out (2016 film)|Lights Out]]'', but it was then moved by Warner Bros. from its original release date of July 22, 2016 to February 17, 2017, alongside ''[[Maze Runner: The Death Cure]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/12/knights-of-the-roundtable-king-arthur-guy-ritchie-sully-lights-out-1201670759/|title=Guy Ritchie's King Arthur Film Gallops To 2017, 'Lights Out' On July 22, 2016: WB Release Date Changes|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|publisher=[[Deadline.com]]|date=21 December 2015|accessdate=22 December 2015}}</ref> Warner Bros. moved the release date from February 17, 2017 to March 24, 2017.<ref name=VarietyReleaseChange>{{cite news|title=Charlie Hunnam's King Arthur Movie Pushed Back to March 2017|last=McNary|first=Dave|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/792723-wb-2017-schedule#/slide/1|publisher=Comingsoon.net|date=7 December 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> The title was changed to ''King Arthur: Legend of the Sword'' in July 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Warner Bros. Pictures Comic-Con Plans Announced!|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/701673-warner-bros-pictures-comic-con#/slide/1|accessdate=12 July 2016|date=11 July 2016}}</ref> In December 2016 the release date was again moved, this time to May 12, 2017, possibly so as not to compete with ''[[CHiPs (film)|CHiPs]]''.<ref>{{cite news|title=Guy Ritchie's King Arthur Has A New Release Date, And It's Brutal|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/news/1596960/guy-ritchies-king-arthur-has-a-new-release-date-and-its-brutal|accessdate=24 April 2017|work=CinemaBlend|date=7 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://screenrant.com/release-dates-king-arthur-annabelle-2-chips/|title=Warner Bros. Shifts King Arthur, CHiPS & Annabelle 2 Release Dates|date=7 December 2016|publisher=screenrant.com|accessdate=24 April 2017}}</ref>
===Promotion=== The trailer was released on 23 July 2016, during the 2016 San Diego Comic-Con and was attached to screenings of ''[[Mechanic: Resurrection]]'', ''[[Don't Breathe]]'', ''[[Shut In (2016 film)|Shut In]]'' and ''[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]''.
It was originally planned for an [[IMAX]] release on 22 July 2016, as evident in the Comic-Con trailer,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.imax.com/movies/king-arthur-legend-sword|title=King Arthur: Legend of the Sword in IMAX|publisher=imax.com|accessdate=24 April 2017}}</ref> but was cancelled due to it being postponed and only received non-IMAX presentations.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}} The first extended TV spot was released on 22 January 2017, and was shown on the 2017 NFC Championship Game on [[Fox Broadcasting Company]] between the [[Atlanta Falcons]] and the [[Green Bay Packers]] and the 2017 AFC Championship Game on [[CBS]] between the [[Pittsburgh Steelers]] and the [[New England Patriots]].{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
A second trailer was released on 20 February 2017 and was attached to ''[[Logan (film)|Logan]]'', ''[[Kong: Skull Island]]'', ''[[Power Rangers (film)|Power Rangers]]'' and ''[[Ghost in the Shell (2017 film)|Ghost in the Shell]]''. The third and final trailer was released on 1 April 2017 and was attached to ''[[The Fate of the Furious]]'', ''[[The Lost City of Z (film)|The Lost City of Z]]'' (which also starred Hunnam) and ''[[Free Fire]]''. All in all, Warner Bros. spent $135 million on marketing the film.<ref name=opening/>
The film was shown at select [[AMC Theatres]] in a special preview on 27 April 2017, in a promotional event titled "King for a Day." Demand for tickets led AMC to expand the event to 200 theatres.<ref>{{cite news|last1=D'Alessandro|first1=Anthony|title='King Arthur: Legend Of The Sword’ Advance Previews In Huge Demand; AMC Ups Theater Count|url=http://deadline.com/2017/04/king-arthur-legend-of-the-sword-amc-theatres-previews-1202073122/|accessdate=24 April 2017|work=Deadline|date=20 April 2017}}</ref>
===Home media=== ''King Arthur: Legend of the Sword'' was released on DVD, Blu-ray, [[3D Blu-ray]] and Ultra HD on 8 August 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/King-Arthur-Legend-Charlie-Hunnam/dp/B073C37BPY/|title=King Arthur: Legend of the Sword|date=8 August 2017|publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=30 June 2017}}</ref>
==Reception== ===Box office=== ''King Arthur: Legend of the Sword'' grossed $39.2 million in the United States and Canada and $107 million in other territories for a worldwide total of $146.2 million, against a production budget of $175 million.<ref name=BOM /> [[Deadline Hollywood]] calculated the film lost the studio $153.2 million, when factoring together all expenses and revenues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2018/03/king-arthur-geostorm-monster-trucks-the-promise-the-great-wall-box-office-losses-1202354934/|title=What Were The Biggest Bombs At The 2017 B.O.? Deadline’s Most Valuable Blockbuster Tournament|first=Anthony |last=D'Alessandro|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 29, 2018|accessdate=March 29, 2018}}</ref>
In North America, the film was released alongside ''[[Snatched (2017 film)|Snatched]]'' and was initially projected to gross around $25 million from 3,702 theatres during its opening weekend.<ref name=preview>{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-movie-projector-king-arthur-20170508-htmlstory.html|title='King Arthur: Legend of the Sword' poised for soft box office opening as 'Guardians' rules|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=May 9, 2017}}</ref> It made $1.15 million from Thursday night previews at about 3,200 theatres, but after making just $5.3 million on Friday, weekend projections were lowered to $15 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4291&p=.htm|title='King Arthur' Delivers $1.15M from Thursday Previews, 'Snatched' Takes in $650k|work=[[Box Office Mojo]]|date=May 12, 2017}}</ref> It ended up debuting to $15.4 million, finishing third at the box office. ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' noted that due to the film's $175 million production budget, as well as at least an additional $100 million spent on marketing, the film was destined to be a [[box office bomb]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-bomb-king-arthur-limps-14m-debut-behind-statched-1003531|title=Box-Office Bomb: 'King Arthur' Opens to Disastrous $15M Behind 'Snatched'|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=August 18, 2017|language=en}}</ref> Regarding the cost of the film, the site quoted one finance expert as saying: "Make original IP [intellectual property] for a cost effective price. If it works then spend more if necessary on the sequel. ''King Arthur'' should have been done for $60–80 [million]. Warner Bros. had no reason to spend $175M-plus on this picture."<ref name=opening>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/king-arthur-snatched-guardians-of-the-galaxy-vol-2-weekend-box-office-1202091662/ |title='King Arthur's Head Cut Off With $14.7M Opening As 'Snatched' Swims To $17.5M in A 'Guardians'-Ruled Mother's Day Weekend|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date= May 15, 2017|accessdate=May 15, 2017}}</ref> Comparing its opening to cost, ''[[IndieWire]]'' called the film's failings "historic".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiewire.com/2017/05/box-office-king-arthur-legend-of-the-sword-summer-snatched-1201816814/ |title='King Arthur: Legend of the Sword’ is a Failure, and Summer Box Office Could Follow |date=May 14, 2016 |work=[[IndieWire]]}}</ref> ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' noted that the film would likely lose about $150 million.<ref name=losses>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/box-office-king-arthur-could-lose-150m-falling-sword-1003638|title=Box-Office Meltdown: 'King Arthur' Could Lose $150M After Falling on Its Sword |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=May 15, 2017}}</ref> In its second weekend the film grossed $7.2 million (a drop of 53.5%), finishing 5th at the box office.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/alien-covenant-diary-of-a-wimpy-kid-everything-everything-box-office-previews-1202097673/?iframe=true&theme_preview=true |title=Moviegoers Make $40M Pact With 'Alien: Covenant’, 2nd Best Debut For Sci-Fi Series |publisher=[[Deadline.com]] |date=May 22, 2017}}</ref>
The film debuted at No. 1 in an estimated 29 countries, including Russia, with openings to follow in the United Kingdom, France, South Korea and Australia.<ref>[https://variety.com/2017/film/news/king-arthur-international-box-office-1202426388/ "Box Office: ‘King Arthur’ Stumbles Overseas With $29.1 Million"], Seth Kelly. ''Variety''. May 14, 2017. Retrieved May, 14 2017</ref> Over its opening weekend, it made only $29.1 million worldwide, in 51 non-American countries.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/king-arthur-movie-falls-on-its-sword-in-opening-weekend-1494786805|title='King Arthur' Movie Falls on Its Sword in Opening Weekend|first=Erich|last=Schwartzel|date=May 14, 2017|work=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref>
===Critical response=== On [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film has an approval rating of 29% based on 230 reviews and an [[Weighted arithmetic mean|average rating]] of 4.7/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "''King Arthur: Legend of the Sword'' piles mounds of modern action flash on an age-old tale – and wipes out much of what made it a classic story in the first place."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/king_arthur_legend_of_the_sword|title=King Arthur: Legend of the Sword (2017)|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes|accessdate=2 March 2018}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalised rating, the film has a score 41 out of 100 based 45 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/king-arthur-legend-of-the-sword|title=King Arthur: Legend of the Sword reviews|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=2 June 2017}}</ref> On [[CinemaScore]], audiences gave the film an average grade of "B+" on an A+ to F scale, while [[PostTrak]] reporter filmgoers gave it an overall positive score of 78%; 56% of the opening weekend filmgoers were under the age of 35, and 59% were men.<ref name=opening/>
Writing for ''[[The Guardian]]'', [[Peter Bradshaw]] gave the film a generally positive review: "Guy Ritchie’s cheerfully ridiculous Arthur is a gonzo monarch, a death-metal warrior-king. Ritchie’s film is at all times over the top, crashing around its digital landscapes in all manner of beserkness, sometimes whooshing along, sometimes stuck in the odd narrative doldrum. But it is often surprisingly entertaining, and whatever clunkers he has delivered in the past, Ritchie again shows that a film-maker of his craft and energy commands attention, and part of his confidence in reviving King Arthur resides here in being so unselfconscious and unconcerned about the student canon that has gone before."<ref>{{cite news |last=Bradshaw |first=Peter |authorlink=Peter Bradshaw |date=9 May 2017 |title=Review of Guy Ritchie's ''King Arthur'' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/may/09/king-arthur-the-legend-of-the-sword-review-guy-ritchies-den-of-medieval-dodginess |work=[[The Guardian]] |location=London |access-date=18 May 2017}}</ref>
In a pan of the film for the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'', [[Michael Phillips (critic)|Michael Phillips]] questioned the long-term longevity of the projected series of six ''Arthur'' films from Ritchie: "I'm no businessman, but plans for a six-film franchise may be optimistic. Optimism is nowhere to be found in Ritchie's movie itself. It is a grim and stupid thing, from one of the world's most successful mediocre filmmakers, and if [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare]]'s [[King Lear]] were blogging today, he'd supply the [[blurb]] quote: 'Nothing will come of nothing.'."<ref>Michael Phillips. {{citation|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/movies/sc-king-arthur-mov-rev-0509-20170511-column.html|title=Review of Guy Ritchie's ''King Arthur''}} ''[[Chicago Tribune]]''.</ref> [[Matt Zoller Seitz]] of [[RogerEbert.com]] gave the film one-and-a-half out of four stars, stating that despite the potential for a revisionist King Arthur story with "[t]he Ritchie sense of style", the overall problem is the film's lack of modulation: "Ritchie keeps rushing us along for two hours, as if to make absolutely certain that we never have time to absorb any character or moment, much less revel in the glorious, cheeky ridiculousness of the whole thing."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Seitz|first1=Matt Zoller|title=King Arthur: Legend of the Sword Movie Review (2017) |url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/king-arthur-legend-of-the-sword-2017 |publisher=RogerEbert.com |accessdate=14 May 2017|date=12 May 2017}}</ref>
Alissa Wilkinson of ''[[Vox (website)|Vox]]'' writes that the film is "surprisingly good, and surprisingly political" in relation to the [[Brexit|British withdrawal from the European Union]], and "occasionally, it's even pretty great".<ref>[https://www.vox.com/culture/2017/5/11/15508278/king-arthur-review-charlie-hunnam-guy-ritchie-jude-law "King Arthur: Legend of the Sword is surprisingly good, and surprisingly political"], Alissa Wilkinson. Vox.com. 11 May 2017. Retrieved 14 May 2017</ref> Chris Hartwell of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' expressed disappointment in the film's lackluster box office performance denying a sequel for the introduction of [[Merlin]], stating it would have been more successful as a solo film instead of setting up a franchise.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/king-arthur-legend-sword-was-killed-by-sequel-1003593|title=How 'King Arthur' Was Killed by a Would-Be Franchise|publisher=}}</ref>

news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/behind-screen/lion-king-disney-unveils-jaw-dropping-first-footage-jon-favreaus-remake-at-d23-1021535|last=Giardina|first=Carolyn|title='Lion King': Disney Unveils Jaw-Dropping First Footage Of Jon Favreau's Remake at D23|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 15, 2017|accessdate=July 15, 2017}} === Music === On November 1, 2017, it was announced that [[Hans Zimmer]] would return to score the film, having previously scored the 1994 animated version.{{cite news|url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Beyonce-and-Additional-Casting-Revealed-in-New-Preview-Poster-for-THE-LION-KING-20171101|last1=Criscitiello |first1=Alaxa|title=Beyoncé and More Additional Casting Revealed in New Preview Poster for ''The Lion King''|publisher=''Broadway World''|date=November 1, 2017|accessdate=November 2, 2017}} On November 28, 2017, it was reported that [[Elton John]] had signed onto the project to rework his musical compositions from the original film before his retirement.{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/confidential/elton-john-set-rake-article-1.3660427|title=Elton John will make millions with live-action remake of ''The Lion King''|work=[[New York Daily News]]|date=November 28, 2017|accessdate=November 28, 2017}} The following day it was reported that Beyoncé would be assisting John in the reworking of the soundtrack.{{cite news|url=http://www.nme.com/news/film/beyonce-elton-john-lion-king-songs-recording-report-2166304|title=Beyoncé and Elton John are reportedly working on new versions of ''The Lion King'' songs|work=[[NME]]|date=November 29, 2017|accessdate=December 5, 2017}} On February 9, 2018, John reported that he, [[Tim Rice]] and Beyoncé would create a new song for the end credits of the film.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/the-lion-king/news/a849649/disney-lion-king-remake-sir-elton-john-tim-rice-beyonce-collaboration/|title=Sir Elton John confirms new Tim Rice collaboration for Disney's ''The Lion King'' remake|work=[[Digital Spy]]|date=February 10, 2018|accessdate=February 11, 2018}} Later that month, it was revealed that four songs from the original film would be included in the film: "[[Can You Feel the Love Tonight]]", "[[Hakuna Matata (song)|Hakuna Matata]]", "[[I Just Can't Wait to Be King]]", and "[[Circle of Life]]".{{cite news|last=Cabin|first=Chris|url=http://collider.com/the-lion-king-remake-soundtrack-tim-rice/|title=''The Lion King'': Live-Action Remake Will Only Use Five Songs from the Original's Soundtrack|work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]]|date=February 18, 2018|accessdate=February 18, 2018}} == Release == ''The Lion King'' is scheduled to be released on July 19, 2019, which marks the 25th anniversary of the release of the original film.{{cite news|last1=Lesnick|first1=Silas|title=Disney Movie Release Schedule Gets a Major Update|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/841525-disney-movie-schedule|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=ComingSoon.net|date=April 25, 2017}} ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links ==
